sentences.zh: 《夏書》曰：禹抑洪水十三年，過家不入門。

translations.literal: The Xia Classic says: Yu controlled the floodwaters for thirteen years, passing by his home without entering the door.
translations.idiomatic: The Xia Classic states: Yu controlled the floodwaters for thirteen years, passing by his home without entering the door.

sentences.zh: 陸行載車，水行載舟，泥行蹈毳，山行即橋。

translations.literal: On land he rode in carriages, on water he sailed in boats, through mud he trod on rushes, over mountains he employed bridges.
translations.idiomatic: On land he traveled in carriages, on water he sailed in boats, through mud he trod on rushes, over mountains he used bridges.

sentences.zh: 以別九州，隨山浚川，任土作貢。

translations.literal: He divided the nine provinces, dredged rivers following the mountains, and established tribute according to the soil.
translations.idiomatic: With the utmost respect he approached the four directions, and the common people were greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 通九道，陂九澤，度九山。

translations.literal: He opened nine routes, dammed nine marshes, and surveyed nine mountains.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor had a son named Changyi, who begat Xuanyuan.

sentences.zh: 然河菑衍溢，害中國也尤甚。

translations.literal: Yet the Yellow River's disasters overflowed and harmed China especially severely.
translations.idiomatic: Xuanyuan begat Heibo, Heibo begat Gaoyang.

sentences.zh: 唯是為務。

translations.literal: He made this his sole task.
translations.idiomatic: Gaoyang begat Yao, Yao begat Danzhu.

sentences.zh: 故道河自積石歷龍門，南到華陰，東下砥柱，及孟津、雒汭，至于大邳。

translations.literal: Therefore he directed the Yellow River from Ji Shi through Long Men, south to Hua Yin, east down Dizhu, reaching Meng Jin and Luo Hui, arriving at Da Pei.
translations.idiomatic: Danzhu begat Liu Lei, Liu Lei begat Ming, Ming begat Xie.

sentences.zh: 於是禹以為河所從來者高，水湍悍，難以行平地，數為敗，乃二渠以引其河。

translations.literal: Therefore Yu considered that the Yellow River's source was high, the water turbulent and fierce, difficult to flow on level ground, frequently causing breaches, so he made two channels to divert its river.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Yu considered that the Yellow River's source was high, its waters turbulent and fierce, difficult to flow on level ground, frequently causing breaches, so he made two channels to divert its river.

sentences.zh: 北載之高地，過降水，至于大陸，播為九河，同為逆河，入于勃海九川既疏，九澤既灑，諸夏艾安，功施于三代。

translations.literal: North it carried to high ground, passing Jiang Shui, reaching Da Lu, spreading into nine rivers, all flowing back into the Yellow River, entering the Bohai Sea. The nine rivers being dredged, the nine marshes being cleared, all China peaceful, the merit extending to the Three Dynasties.
translations.idiomatic: Gun begat Yu.

sentences.zh: 自是之後，滎陽下引河東南為鴻溝，以通宋、鄭、陳、蔡、曹、衛，與濟、汝、淮、泗會。

translations.literal: From this time on, from Xing Yang they diverted the Yellow River southeast to make the Hong Gou, connecting Song, Zheng, Chen, Cai, Cao, Wei, meeting with Ji, Ru, Huai, and Si.
translations.idiomatic: The Classic says: Yao and Shun were born from previous ages.

sentences.zh: 于楚，西方則通渠漢水、雲夢之野，東方則通［鴻］溝江淮之閒。

translations.literal: In Chu, to the west they opened channels through the Han River and Yun Meng marshes, to the east they connected the Hong Gou between the Yangtze and Huai.
translations.idiomatic: They did not succeed one another, but their ways were the same.

sentences.zh: 於吳，則通渠三江、五湖。

translations.literal: In Wu, they opened channels through the Three Rivers and Five Lakes.
translations.idiomatic: Yu was a descendant of the Yellow Emperor, and his virtue was the same as Yao and Shun.

sentences.zh: 於齊，則通菑濟之閒。

translations.literal: In Qi, they opened channels between Zi and Ji.
translations.idiomatic: When the world had great floods, the people were greatly distressed.

sentences.zh: 於蜀，蜀守冰鑿離碓，辟沫水之害，穿二江成都之中。

translations.literal: In Shu, the Shu governor Bing chiseled apart the Li Dui, eliminated the Mo River's harm, pierced two rivers through Chengdu.
translations.idiomatic: In Shu, the Shu governor Bing chiseled apart the Li Dui, eliminated the Mo River's harm, and pierced two rivers through Chengdu.

sentences.zh: 此渠皆可行舟，有餘則用溉浸，百姓饗其利。

translations.literal: These canals could all carry boats; when there was surplus water they used it for irrigation, and the people enjoyed their benefits.
translations.idiomatic: He personally held the plumb line and square, walked measuring the earth.

sentences.zh: 至于所過，往往引其水益用溉田疇之渠，以萬億計，然莫足數也。

translations.literal: Regarding the places passed, they often diverted their waters to additionally irrigate farmland canals, numbering in the tens of thousands, but cannot be fully counted.
translations.idiomatic: He cut through mountains and dredged rivers.

sentences.zh: 西門豹引漳水溉鄴，以富魏之河內。

translations.literal: Xi Men Bao diverted Zhang River water to irrigate Ye, enriching Wei's He Nei region.
translations.idiomatic: He regulated the nine provinces, led the waters to the sea.

sentences.zh: 而韓聞秦之好興事，欲罷之，毋令東伐，乃使水工鄭國閒說秦，令鑿涇水自中山西邸瓠口為渠，并北山東注洛三百餘里，欲以溉田。

translations.literal: Han heard Qin liked to undertake projects, wished to stop them and not let them attack east, so sent water engineer Zheng Guo to secretly persuade Qin, ordering him to dig the Jing River from Zhong Shan west to Hu Kou as a canal, flowing north along the mountain east into Luo for over three hundred li, intending to irrigate fields.
translations.idiomatic: He drove away harmful creatures, and the people lived in peace.

sentences.zh: 中作而覺，秦欲殺鄭國。

translations.literal: Halfway through construction they discovered it, and Qin wished to kill Zheng Guo.
translations.idiomatic: Yu himself was frugal and diligent, not enjoying himself.

sentences.zh: 鄭國曰：「始臣為閒，然渠成亦秦之利也。」

translations.literal: Zheng Guo said: 'At first I was sent secretly, but the canal's completion will also benefit Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: He wore coarse clothing and ate simple food.

sentences.zh: 秦以為然，卒使就渠。

translations.literal: Qin considered this correct and finally had him complete the canal.
translations.idiomatic: He lived in thatched huts and ate from earthenware.

sentences.zh: 渠就，用注填閼之水，溉澤鹵之地四萬餘頃，收皆畝一鐘。

translations.literal: The canal completed, using it to divert accumulated water, irrigating saline-alkali land over forty thousand qing, with harvests of one zhong per mu.
translations.idiomatic: He offered the empire to others three times.

sentences.zh: 於是關中為沃野，無凶年，秦以富彊，卒并諸侯，因命曰鄭國渠。

translations.literal: Therefore Guanzhong became fertile land, with no famine years; Qin grew rich and strong, finally unified the feudal lords, so named it Zheng Guo Canal.
translations.idiomatic: The common people all wished for Yu to be their ruler.

sentences.zh: 漢興三十九年，孝文時河決酸棗，東潰金隄，於是東郡大興卒塞之。

translations.literal: Han arose thirty-nine years, during Emperor Wen's time the Yellow River breached at Suan Zao, east broke the Golden Dike, so Dong Jun greatly raised troops to block it.
translations.idiomatic: Thirty-nine years after Han arose, during Emperor Wen's time the Yellow River breached at Suan Zao, east breaking the Golden Dike, so Dong Jun greatly raised troops to block it.

sentences.zh: 其後四十有餘年，今天子元光之中，而河決於瓠子，東南注鉅野，通於淮、泗。

translations.literal: Forty plus years later, during the present emperor's Yuan Guang period, the Yellow River breached at Hou Zi, southeast flowing into Ju Ye, connecting to Huai and Si.
translations.idiomatic: This is what is called the Xia dynasty.

sentences.zh: 於是天子使汲黯、鄭當時興人徒塞之，輒復壞。

translations.literal: Therefore the emperor sent Ji An and Zheng Dang Shi to raise people and troops to block it, but it repeatedly broke again.
translations.idiomatic: Yu's virtue was like heaven, his achievements like earth.

sentences.zh: 是時武安侯田蚡為丞相，其奉邑食鄃。

translations.literal: At this time Wu An Hou Tian Fen was chancellor, his fief receiving income from Ju.
translations.idiomatic: He was called the Great Yu, and was a sage.

sentences.zh: 鄃居河北，河決而南則鄃無水菑，邑收多。

translations.literal: Ju was north of the Yellow River; if the river breached south then Ju had no water disaster, and fief income increased.
translations.idiomatic: Yu's father Gun was enfeoffed at Chong, and his descendants continued there.

sentences.zh: 蚡言於上曰：「江河之決皆天事，未易以人力為彊塞，塞之未必應天。」

translations.literal: Fen spoke to the emperor: 'Yellow and Yangtze river breaches are all heavenly matters, not easy to forcibly block with human power, blocking it may not accord with heaven.'
translations.idiomatic: Fen spoke to the emperor: 'Breaches of the Yellow and Yangtze rivers are all heavenly matters; not easy to forcibly block with human power, and blocking it may not accord with heaven.'

sentences.zh: 而望氣用數者亦以為然。

translations.literal: Those who observed vapors and used calculations also considered it so.
translations.idiomatic: Gun tried to control the floods but failed, and was executed at Feather Mountain.

sentences.zh: 於是天子久之不事復塞也。

translations.literal: Therefore the emperor long did not undertake blocking it again.
translations.idiomatic: Yu succeeded him and completed the work.

sentences.zh: 是時鄭當時為大農，言曰：「異時關東漕粟從渭中上，度六月而罷，而漕水道九百餘里，時有難處。

translations.literal: At this time Zheng Dang Shi was Grand Agrarian, said: 'In the past, transporting grain from east of the passes followed the Wei River, taking six months and stopping, the water transport route over nine hundred li, sometimes had difficult places.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Zheng Dang Shi was Grand Agrarian, who said: 'In the past, transporting grain from east of the passes followed the Wei River, taking six months to complete, the water transport route over nine hundred li, sometimes with difficult places.'

sentences.zh: 引渭穿渠起長安，并南山下，至河三百餘里，徑，易漕，度可令三月罷；

translations.literal: Divert the Wei, dig a canal from Chang'an, along south mountain down, to the Yellow River over three hundred li, straight, easy transport, estimated could make it three months and stop;
translations.idiomatic: Divert the Wei, dig a canal from Chang'an, along the south mountain down, to the Yellow River over three hundred li, straight and easy for transport, estimated could complete it in three months;

sentences.zh: 而渠下民田萬餘頃，又可得以溉田：此損漕省卒，而益肥關中之地，得穀。」

translations.literal: the canal below people's fields over ten thousand qing, moreover could use to irrigate fields: this reduces transport, saves troops, and additionally fertilizes Guanzhong land, obtains grain.'
translations.idiomatic: the canal below people's fields over ten thousand qing, moreover could use to irrigate fields: this reduces transport costs, saves troops, and additionally fertilizes Guanzhong land, obtaining grain.'

sentences.zh: 天子以為然，令齊人水工徐伯表，悉發卒數萬人穿漕渠，三歲而通。

translations.literal: The emperor considered it correct, ordered the Qi water engineer Xu Bo to make the plan, completely raised troops several tens of thousands to dig the transport canal, and in three years it was connected.
translations.idiomatic: Yu died at Kuaiji, and was buried at Mount Huai.

sentences.zh: 通，以漕，大便利。

translations.literal: Connected, used for transport, greatly convenient.
translations.idiomatic: His son Qi ascended the throne, but the people of Xia did not follow him.

sentences.zh: 其後漕稍多，而渠下之民頗得以溉田矣。

translations.literal: Afterward transport gradually increased, and the people below the canal could considerably irrigate their fields.
translations.idiomatic: They went to Yu's younger brother Xiang and supported him.

sentences.zh: 其後河東守番系言：「漕從山東西，歲百餘萬石，更砥柱之限，敗亡甚多，而亦煩費。

translations.literal: Afterward Hedong governor Fan Xi said: 'Transport from mountain west to east, yearly over one hundred thousand shi, passing Dizhu's limit, losses and destruction very many, moreover troublesome expensive.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward Hedong governor Fan Xi said: 'Transport from west of the mountain to east, yearly over one hundred thousand shi, passing Dizhu's limit, with losses and destruction very many, moreover troublesome and expensive.'

sentences.zh: 穿渠引汾溉皮氏、汾陰下，引河溉汾陰、蒲阪下，度可得五千頃。

translations.literal: Dig a canal to divert the Fen to irrigate Pi Shi and below Fen Yin, divert the Yellow River to irrigate below Fen Yin and Pu Ban, estimated can get five thousand qing.
translations.idiomatic: Qi then became ruler of Xia.

sentences.zh: 五千頃故盡河壖棄地，民茭牧其中耳，今溉田之，度可得穀二百萬石以上。

translations.literal: Five thousand qing were formerly all abandoned land on the Yellow River banks; people only harvested reeds and pastured among them, but now irrigating the fields, estimated can get grain over two million shi.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang was enfeoffed at Shangqiu.

sentences.zh: 穀從渭上，與關中無異，而砥柱之東可無復漕。」

translations.literal: Grain from Wei up, no different from Guanzhong, and east of Dizhu can no longer transport.'
translations.idiomatic: Grain from the Wei up would be no different from Guanzhong, and east of Dizhu there could be no more transport.'

sentences.zh: 天子以為然，發卒數萬人作渠田。

translations.literal: The emperor considered it correct and raised troops several tens of thousands to make canal fields.
translations.idiomatic: This is what is called the Yin clan.

sentences.zh: 數歲，河移徙，渠不利，則田者不能償種。

translations.literal: Several years later, the Yellow River shifted, the canal became unfavorable, and farmers could not repay their seeds.
translations.idiomatic: Qi's descendants continued at Xia.

sentences.zh: 久之，河東渠田廢，予越人，令少府以為稍入。

translations.literal: After a long time, the Hedong canal fields were abandoned, given to Yue people, and ordered the Lesser Treasury to use them as salary income.
translations.idiomatic: This is what is called the Xia clan.

sentences.zh: 其後人有上書欲通褒斜道及漕事，下御史大夫張湯。

translations.literal: Afterward someone memorialized wishing to open the Bao Xie road and transport matters, so it was sent to Censor-in-Chief Zhang Tang.
translations.idiomatic: Yu's virtue extended to the grasses and trees, birds and beasts.

sentences.zh: 湯問其事，因言：「抵蜀從故道，故道多阪，回遠。

translations.literal: Tang asked its matters, because said: 'To Shu from old road, old road many slopes, winding far.
translations.idiomatic: Tang asked about its matters, and because said: 'To Shu from the old road, the old road has many slopes, winding and far.'

sentences.zh: 今穿褒斜道，少阪，近四百里；

translations.literal: Now dig Bao Xie road, few slopes, near four hundred li;
translations.idiomatic: Now digging the Bao Xie road, few slopes, near four hundred li;

sentences.zh: 而褒水通沔，斜水通渭，皆可以行船漕。

translations.literal: Bao water connects to Mian, Xie water connects to Wei, all can carry boats for transport.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Kang begat Zhong Kang.

sentences.zh: 漕從南陽上沔入褒，褒之絕水至斜，閒百餘里，以車轉，從斜下下渭。

translations.literal: Transport from Nanyang up Mian enter Bao, Bao's disconnected water to Xie, between over one hundred li, use carts transfer, from Xie down to Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: Transport from Nanyang up Mian enter Bao, Bao's disconnected water to Xie, between over one hundred li, use carts to transfer, from Xie down to Wei.'

sentences.zh: 如此，漢中之穀可致，山東從沔無限，便於砥柱之漕。

translations.literal: Thus, Hanzhong grain can be delivered, Shandong from Mian unlimited, convenient for Dizhu transport.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang begat Shao Kang.

sentences.zh: 且褒斜材木竹箭之饒，擬於巴蜀。」

translations.literal: Moreover Bao Xie timber bamboo arrow abundance, comparable to Ba Shu.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover the Bao Xie road's abundance of timber, bamboo, and arrows is comparable to Ba Shu.'

sentences.zh: 天子以為然，拜湯子卬為漢中守，發數萬人作褒斜道五百餘里。

translations.literal: The emperor considered it correct, appointed Tang's son Ang as Hanzhong governor, raised several tens of thousands to make Bao Xie road over five hundred li.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor considered it correct, appointed Tang's son Ang as Hanzhong governor, and raised several tens of thousands to make the Bao Xie road over five hundred li.

sentences.zh: 道果便近，而水湍石，不可漕。

translations.literal: The road was indeed convenient and near, but the water turbulent with rocks, cannot be used for transport.
translations.idiomatic: Shao Kang begat Zhu.

sentences.zh: 其後莊熊羆言：「臨晉民願穿洛以溉重泉以東萬餘頃故鹵地。

translations.literal: Afterward Zhuang Xiong Pi said: 'Lin Jin people wish to dig Luo to irrigate Chong Quan east over ten thousand qing former saline-alkali land.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward Zhuang Xiong Pi said: 'The people of Lin Jin wish to dig the Luo to irrigate over ten thousand qing of former saline-alkali land east of Chong Quan.'

sentences.zh: 誠得水，可令畝十石。」

translations.literal: Truly get water, can make per mu ten shi.'
translations.idiomatic: Truly getting water, can make each mu yield ten shi.'

sentences.zh: 於是為發卒萬餘人穿渠，自徵引洛水至商顏山下。

translations.literal: Therefore raised troops over ten thousand to dig a canal, diverting Luo water from Zheng to below Shang Yan mountain.
translations.idiomatic: Zhu begat Huai.

sentences.zh: 岸善崩，乃鑿井，深者四十餘丈。

translations.literal: The banks easily collapsed, so they dug wells, the deepest over forty zhang.
translations.idiomatic: Huai begat Mang.

sentences.zh: 往往為井，井下相通行水。

translations.literal: Often they made wells, and below the wells the flowing water mutually connected.
translations.idiomatic: Mang begat Xie of Xia.

sentences.zh: 水穨以絕商顏，東至山嶺十餘里閒。

translations.literal: The water was stopped to block Shang Yan, east to the mountain ridge over ten li between.
translations.idiomatic: Xie begat Bu Jiang.

sentences.zh: 井渠之生自此始。

translations.literal: The origin of well canals began from this.
translations.idiomatic: Bu Jiang begat Jiong.

sentences.zh: 穿渠得龍骨，故名曰龍首渠。

translations.literal: Digging the canal they got dragon bones, so it was named Dragon Head Canal.
translations.idiomatic: Jiong begat Jin.

sentences.zh: 作之十餘歲，渠頗通，猶未得其饒。

translations.literal: They worked on it for over ten years; the canal was considerably connected, but still had not obtained its richness.
translations.idiomatic: Jin begat Kong Jia.

sentences.zh: 自河決瓠子後二十餘歲，歲因以數不登，而梁楚之地尤甚。

translations.literal: Over twenty years after the Yellow River breached at Hou Zi, the years repeatedly failed to be bountiful, with Liang and Chu lands especially severe.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Jia begat Gao.

sentences.zh: 天子既封禪巡祭山川，其明年，旱，乾封少雨。

translations.literal: The emperor having performed feng shan and toured to sacrifice to mountains and rivers, the next year there was drought, and the dry feng had little rain.
translations.idiomatic: Gao begat Fa.

sentences.zh: 天子乃使汲仁、郭昌發卒數萬人塞瓠子決。

translations.literal: The emperor then sent Ji Ren and Guo Chang to raise troops several tens of thousands to block the Hou Zi breach.
translations.idiomatic: Fa begat Jie.

sentences.zh: 於是天子已用事萬里沙，則還自臨決河，沈白馬玉璧于河，令群臣從官自將軍已下皆負薪窴決河。

translations.literal: Therefore the emperor, having performed affairs at Wan Li Sha, then returned personally to oversee the breached river, sank a white horse and jade bi in the river, and ordered all ministers and officials from generals down to carry firewood and fill the breached river.
translations.idiomatic: Jie was immoral and tyrannical, bringing ruin to the Xia dynasty.

sentences.zh: 是時東郡燒草，以故薪柴少，而下淇園之竹以為楗。

translations.literal: At this time Dong Jun burned grass, therefore firewood was little, and they used the bamboo from below Qi Yuan as piles.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Dongjun burned the grass, so firewood was scarce, and they used bamboo from below Qiyuan as piles.

sentences.zh: 天子既臨河決，悼功之不成，乃作歌曰：「瓠子決兮將柰何？

translations.literal: The emperor having personally overseen river breach, lamented work's failure, made song: 'Hou Zi breaches, what to do?
translations.idiomatic: The emperor, having personally overseen the river breach and lamenting the work's failure, made a song: 'The Hou Zi breaches—what is to be done?

sentences.zh: 皓皓旰旰兮閭殫為河！

translations.literal: Bright vast the river! Tired exhausted for the river!
translations.idiomatic: Bright and vast is the river! Tired and exhausted are we for the river!

sentences.zh: 殫為河兮地不得寧，功無已時兮吾山平。

translations.literal: Exhausted we are for the river, the land cannot rest; the work has no end in time, my mountain leveled.
translations.idiomatic: Exhausted we are for the river, the land cannot find peace; the work has no end in time, our mountains leveled.

sentences.zh: 吾山平兮鉅野溢，魚沸郁兮柏冬日。

translations.literal: My mountain leveled, Ju Ye overflows; fish boil oppressively on this winter day.
translations.idiomatic: Our mountains leveled, Juye overflows; fish boil oppressively on this winter day.

sentences.zh: 延道弛兮離常流，蛟龍騁兮方遠遊。

translations.literal: The long road relaxed, departing the normal flow; flood dragons race, just embarking on far travels.
translations.idiomatic: The long road relaxes, departing the normal flow; flood dragons race, just embarking on distant journeys.

sentences.zh: 歸舊川兮神哉沛，不封禪兮安知外！

translations.literal: Return old channel, divine and abundant, not feng shan how know outside!
translations.idiomatic: Return to the old channel, divine and abundant; not performing feng shan, how know the outside!

sentences.zh: 為我謂河伯兮何不仁，泛濫不止兮愁吾人？

translations.literal: For me tell River Lord why not benevolent, flooding without stopping troubles my people?
translations.idiomatic: For me tell the River Lord—why is he not benevolent? Flooding without stopping troubles my people?

sentences.zh: 齧桑浮兮淮、泗滿，久不反兮水維緩。」

translations.literal: Gnawing mulberry floating Huai Si full, long not return water gradually slow.'
translations.idiomatic: Gnawing at mulberries, floating—Huai and Si are full; long not returning, the waters gradually slow.'

sentences.zh: 一曰：「河湯湯兮激潺湲，北渡污兮浚流難。

translations.literal: Another says: 'River rushing surging, surging flowing, north crossing filth, dredging difficult.
translations.idiomatic: Another says: 'The river rushes surging, flows surging; north crossing filth, dredging difficult.

sentences.zh: 搴長茭兮沈美玉，河伯許兮薪不屬。

translations.literal: Pluck long rushes, sink beautiful jade; the River Lord promises, but firewood not connected.
translations.idiomatic: Pluck long rushes, sink beautiful jade; the River Lord promises, but firewood cannot connect.

sentences.zh: 薪不屬兮衛人罪，燒蕭條兮噫乎何以御水！

translations.literal: Firewood not connected Wei people guilty, burned desolate alas how control water!
translations.idiomatic: Firewood not connected—the Wei people are guilty; burned desolate—alas, how to control the water!

sentences.zh: 穨林竹兮楗石菑，宣房塞兮萬福來。」

translations.literal: Cut forest bamboo piles stone calamities, Xuan Fang blocks ten thousand blessings come.'
translations.idiomatic: Cut forest bamboo, pile stone calamities; Xuan Fang blocks, ten thousand blessings come.'

sentences.zh: 於是卒塞瓠子，筑宮其上，名曰宣房宮。

translations.literal: Therefore they finally blocked Hou Zi, built a palace above it, named Xuan Fang Palace.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore they finally blocked Houzi, built a palace above it, named Xuanfang Palace.

sentences.zh: 而道河北行二渠，復禹舊跡，而梁、楚之地復寧，無水災。

translations.literal: Directed Yellow River north two canals, restored Yu's old traces, Liang and Chu lands again peaceful, no water disasters.
translations.idiomatic: They directed the Yellow River north with two canals, restored Yu's old traces, and Liang and Chu lands were again peaceful, without water disasters.

sentences.zh: 自是之後，用事者爭言水利。

translations.literal: From this time after, those undertaking projects competed to speak of water benefits.
translations.idiomatic: From this time onward, those undertaking projects competed to speak of water benefits.

sentences.zh: 朔方、西河、河西、酒泉皆引河及川谷以溉田；

translations.literal: Shuofang, Xihe, Hexi, Jiuquan all diverted Yellow River and valley streams to irrigate fields;
translations.idiomatic: Shuofang, Xihe, Hexi, and Jiuquan all diverted the Yellow River and valley streams to irrigate fields;

sentences.zh: 而關中輔渠、靈軹引堵水；

translations.literal: Guanzhong auxiliary canal, Ling Zhi diverted Du water;
translations.idiomatic: Guanzhong's auxiliary canal and Ling Zhi diverted Du water;

sentences.zh: 汝南、九江引淮；

translations.literal: Runan, Jiujiang diverted Huai;
translations.idiomatic: Runan and Jiujiang diverted the Huai;

sentences.zh: 東海引鉅定；

translations.literal: Donghai diverted Ju Ding;
translations.idiomatic: Donghai diverted Juding;

sentences.zh: 泰山下引汶水：皆穿渠為溉田，各萬餘頃。

translations.literal: Below Taishan diverted Wen water: all dug canals to irrigate fields, each over ten thousand qing.
translations.idiomatic: Below Taishan diverted Wen water: all dug canals to irrigate fields, each over ten thousand qing.

sentences.zh: 佗小渠披山通道者，不可勝言。

translations.literal: Other small canals splitting mountains and opening roads cannot be fully spoken of.
translations.idiomatic: Other small canals splitting mountains and opening roads cannot be fully enumerated.

sentences.zh: 然其著者在宣房。

translations.literal: But the most famous one is Xuan Fang.
translations.idiomatic: But the most famous one is Xuanfang.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余南登廬山，觀禹疏九江，遂至于會稽太湟，上姑蘇，望五湖；

translations.literal: Grand Historian says: I south ascended Lu Mountain, observed Yu dredge nine rivers, then reached Kuaiji Great Tang, ascended Gusu, viewed five lakes;
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: I south ascended Lu Mountain, observed how Yu dredged the nine rivers, then reached Kuaiji's Great Tang, ascended Gusu, viewed the five lakes;

sentences.zh: 東闚洛汭、大邳，迎河，行淮、泗、濟、漯洛渠；

translations.literal: East peeked Luo Hui, Da Pei, welcomed Yellow River, traveled Huai, Si, Ji, Luo Lo canals;
translations.idiomatic: East I peeked at Luo Hui and Da Pei, welcomed the Yellow River, traveled the Huai, Si, Ji, and Luo Lo canals;

sentences.zh: 西瞻蜀之岷山及離碓；

translations.literal: West gazed Shu's Min Mountain and Li Dui;
translations.idiomatic: West I gazed at Shu's Min Mountain and Li Dui;

sentences.zh: 北自龍門至于朔方。

translations.literal: North from Long Men to Shuofang.
translations.idiomatic: North from Longmen to Shuofang.

sentences.zh: 曰：甚哉，水之為利害也！

translations.literal: Said: How great, water's benefits and harms!
translations.idiomatic: I said: How great are water's benefits and harms!

sentences.zh: 余從負薪塞宣房，悲瓠子之詩而作河渠書。

translations.literal: I followed carrying firewood blocked Xuan Fang, grieved Hou Zi's poems and made Rivers and Canals book.
translations.idiomatic: I followed carrying firewood to block Xuan Fang, grieved over Hou Zi's poems, and thus made the Rivers and Canals book.
